I don't really think that just because something is free means you shouldn't try to make it to be as good a quality as possible.  If you volunteer your time down at the soup kitchen do you do a half-assed job or do you do it right?  Nothing's worth doing if you don't do it with the highest quality in mind - regardless of the price.  No wonder there's so much sh*t out there people think there's actually times when you should just accept sh*t.  Total garbage, I say.

Balanced, you don't seem very balanced. You seem frustrated.
This quality is just as fine as anyone should hope for. Looks fine on my 16 inch screen. There are people who feel guilty just owning a computer because of what the use of billions of computers (which is just the tip of the iceberg) does to the environment.
There are people in the third world aware of what the west is doing to the planet and their environment, who eat every other day, but are full of hope, appreciate life, play ball and have loving people all around them, while the rich in the west are frustrated and angry and yell curses at each other over things like the visual quality on their 80 inch wide-screen nuclear-consuming plasma screens, and never seem to be satisfied due to the lack of love and unity, which has been replaced by pods and pads and gadgets alike whose amounts of electricity-consumption make our bodies tense and our minds stressed.

Lemberg I don't really care what you do.  The point of the matter is to do it right.  360p is NOT 'as fine as any one could hope for'.  I believe that description goes to 1080p right about now.  So whether you got nothing but a rock to kick around or you need to fuel your 80inch nuclear power 3D HD television try and do it with some style, passion, and striving toward better quality.  Otherwise take your fucking rock and just go home because really, what's the point of anything less?

Also - last night someone *did* put the 720p version up but not even an hour later TBP page was 404'd.  HOwever I was lucky enough to grab it and for those of you who don't settle for less here is the magnet link:  magnet:?xt=urn:btih:5e91d2035d08fbed7baa19541b0c3e661af0b111&dn=The+Simpsons+S22E11+720p&tr=http%3A%2F%2Ftracker.publicbt.com%2Fannounce
